channel.title: Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on
channel.description: Recent content in Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on

item.title: Research
item.description: Topics My main research aims at using artificial intelligence techniques to optimize human learning. In this current era where digital access to knowledge is cheap and user attention is expensive, a number of online applications have been developed for learning. These platforms collect a massive amount of data over various profiles, that can be used to improve learning experience: intelligent tutoring systems can infer what activities worked for different types of students in the past, and apply this knowledge to instruct new students.

item.title: Publications
item.description: (save-excursion (ignore-errors (load-library "org-bibtex") (switch-to-buffer (find-file-noselect "~/Org/popineau/Publications.org")) (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-TeXLive.bib" "TeX") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-journal-temp.bib" "journal+EIAH|journal+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-journal.bib" "popineau/Publications-journal-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-inbook-temp.bib" "inbook+EIAH|inbook+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-inbook.bib" "popineau/Publications-inbook-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-conf-temp.bib" "conf+EIAH|conf+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-conf.bib" "popineau/Publications-conf-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-poster-temp.bib" "poster+EIAH|poster+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-poster.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Current Courses since 2018 – Cours Algorithmique et Complexité. CentraleSupelec, campus de Gif. since 2016 – Big Data. CentraleSupelec, campus de Gif, parcours ingénieur Supélec. since 2012 – Modèles du Calcul. Cours de 3ème année Majeure Informatique. CentraleSupelec, campus de Gif, parcours ingénieur Supélec. since 2010 – Intelligence Artificielle. Mineure de 3ème année. CentraleSupelec, campus de Gif, parcours ingénieur Supélec. Others : Formation continue : CQP / Master ASI - Développement d’applications Web en environnement .

item.title: Main publications
item.description: Journal articles Références [1] Jill-Jênn Vie, Fabrice Popineau, Éric Bruillard, and Yolaine Bourda. Utilisation de tests adaptatifs dans les mooc dans un cadre de crowdsourcing. STICEF, pages 1--18, 2017. [ bib ] [2] Youssef Meguebli, Mouna Kacimi, Bich-Liên Doan, and Fabrice Popineau. Towards better news article recommendation. World Wide Web Journal, 20(1):1--20, 2017. [ bib ] [3] Jill-Jênn Vie, Fabrice Popineau, Éric Bruillard, and Yolaine Bourda.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description: The leading textbook about artificial intelligence by Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig has been translated to French. I supervised the French translation of the 2nd and 3rd editions together with Laurent Miclet. The translation by itself has been achieved by a pool of professional translators. It has been a tremendous work at all levels: splitting the translation job and providing translators with the technical vocabulary they missed, gathering translated parts and polishing the result, carefully proofreading the text (3 times!

item.title: TeX related publications, presentations and seminars
item.description: Up to around 2005, I have devoted a great part of my research time to facilitating the dissemination of TeX, resulting in a few TeX related publications. I have maintained the TeXLive distribution of TeX for Windows for about 10 years. This was a demanding but rewarding collaborative work. I have (co-)organized the 2005 EuroTeX meeting in Pont-à-Mousson with Donald E. Knuth and Hermann Zapf as guests. The full proceedings of the conference are available online.
